FuncDef:
The access-trigger loose infinite-lease command enables users with an infinite lease bound to the BAS interface to go online by sending IP/ARP packets when no abnormal logout backup entry is generated.
The undo access-trigger loose infinite-lease command disables users with an infinite lease bound to the BAS interface from going online by sending IP/ARP packets when no abnormal logout backup entry is generated.
By default, users with an infinite lease bound to the BAS interface cannot go online by sending IP/ARP packets when no abnormal logout backup entry is generated.

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates the loose mode for getting online after the system restarts.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To enable users with an infinite lease bound to the BAS interface to go online by sending IP/ARP packets when no abnormal logout backup entry is generated, run the access-trigger loose infinite-lease command.
Prerequisites
User access triggered by IP/ARP packets has been enabled on the BAS interface.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
